posts.post_content:
Due to an overwhelming response, I have added prices and pictures to this post rather than answer all emails directly.  Upon further detailed review, a few of the cards did have some technical issues which can be seen in the scans or I've detailed accordingly.  Prices quoted are for check/money order.  If you wish to utilize Paypal, add an additional 2.5% or you are welcome to pay in a manner where I incur no fees.  I will entertain cash offers on most cards and in any quantities.


I recently acquired a group of T206 that included a couple dozen very high end, crease free, T206 that look anywhere between EX and NM but have a purple stamp on the reverse: "OCT 2 1911".  Unless they are some type of manufacturing samples, I can only assume an original collector stamped these on the date they acquired them back in 1911.  A few examples are shown below for reference (all backs are a version of Piedmont or Sweet Caporal and some were stamped twice).

If you have any interest in obtaining a piece or two for your set or collection, please email me for scans and prices (I will respond with scans as I get time to make them this weekend and I will only respond to emails, not posts). 

Email - [url]ppgustafson@yahoo.com[/url]

I have the following players/teams:

Alperman - Brooklyn ($150)
Ames - NY ($60)
Bates - Boston ($75)
Bell (side arm throwing) - Brooklyn ($60)
Hulswitt - St. Louis ($150)
Hunter - Brooklyn - ($90)
Magee (batting) - Philly ($OLD)
Marshall - Brooklyn ($80)
McQuillan - Philly ($85)
Murray (Portrait) - NY ($100)
Overall - Chicago (creases top right) - ($65)
Pfeister - Chicago ($90)
Phelps - St. Louis (light creases near top right) - ($70)
Seymour (batting) - NY ($150)
Spencer - Boston (tiny spec of paper loss at start of right shirt sleeve) - ($115)
Starr - Boston ($90)
Steinfeldt (Portrait) - Chicago - (very small crease near bottom right - tough to see) ($85)
Sweeney - Boston ($90)
Tenney (Portrait) - NY ($90)
Wiltse (Portrait) - NY ($95)
